Comment.Text: Temporal filtering and spatial filtering is done before epoching. Epochs are extracted based on the stimulation identifier 195 (corresponding to a flash). The stimulation based file reader will read a text file containing lines with zeros and ones. Each line defines which symbols have been flashed during a flash. The classifier outputs the probability for each flash. This probability is then combined by the python script with the info about the symbols being flashed. The evidence accumulator then computes the probabilities for each symbol and outputs the most probable one when a certain threshold is reached. This result is written in shared memory which is read by the p300 stimulator

This is the default scenario that should be used with the external p300 stimulator and the python front end. It can be used for both calibration ( in this case dummy spatial filters and classifer are used), for copy and free spelling. A static classifier is used, nothing is adapted, but it can stop early.
